definition: a genius in retrospect (idiom); hindsight is 20-20
wise after the event (idiom); with hindsight, one should have predicted it

sentences.english: It's much cheaper to anticipate rather than respond.
sentences.chinese: 因为预先做出反应远比事后补救便宜的多。

sentences.english: A Stitch in Time Saves Nine Billion.

sentences.english: In many projects, formal requirements are done as an afterthought, if at all.

sentences.english: I don't think Yogi Chen made any comments about it, then or after it was over.

sentences.english: Afterwards, Ao patient about aunt and monica a pile.

sentences.english: Investigation afterward brought out Bufflehead did not even try to draw his gun.

sentences.english: She later told me that made her feel like garbage.

sentences.english: Can we go and have a drink after that?

sentences.english: Taking preventive action beforehand and remedial action afterwards are the two common methods of warding off taboos.

sentences.english: With the benefit of hindsight, what different steps would you have taken?

sentences.english: Advice after mischeif is like medicine after death.

sentences.english: In such situations, talent becomes clearly defined only after the fact.
sentences.chinese: 在这样的情形下，只有在事后才可明确界定人才。

sentences.english: What a shame, soon after i have known from the newspaper that the result of this match is one to one.
sentences.chinese: 只可惜的是，事后我从报纸上得知比赛结果是一比一。

definition: to be in charge/to be confronted (with a matter)/involved (in some matter)
to consider as a matter of importance/to be of importance
to find out/to know/to learn about
to have an accident/to meet with a mishap
to dispose of a matter/to be done with it
persons involved or implicated/party (to an affair)
